attributes.action: Prevent the mayor of London from expanding the ULEZ zone to Greater London.
attributes.additional_details: The proposed ULEZ expansion will cost millions of people at least £4,000 a year. It will cause such hardship to business, residents, visitors from outside London’s perimeter that the overall economy of London will suffer badly.  Those who give or need care may be prevented from giving it or receiving it. Small businesses may have to close. As it will affect more than Londoners it must be a democratic decision by Parliament, not that of the Mayor of London, who has broken his public promise.
attributes.background: To repeal or modify any existing legal power which gives the Mayor of London the power to charge for the use of vehicles on the public roads on the grounds of the exhaust emissions. So that the ULEZ zone expansion would require a bill to be past in the House of Commons.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. It is the responsibility of the Mayor of London and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Revoke local government powers to charge CAZ, LEZ, ZEZ and ULEZ: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/618266
